intro: Eulophia mumbwaensis, commonly known as the Mumbwa orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms during the dry season, producing clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white blossoms. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires ample sunlight to flourish. Eulophia mumbwaensis is often found in grasslands and forest margins, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
